comments.body: Feels a bit weird to expose `deselectedCurves` in the page URL, but not sure there's a better way of doing this (see the comment)

My feeling is that we are having this URL information explosion because we are using the browser URL as a poor man's dashboard/visualization persistence layer. Ideally, in the future, we can have an "MLflow Board" similar to what tensor board offers where we can pull in on-demand tracking resources like experiments and runs, create plots on top of them and have the entire dashboard persisted under a single dashboard id.

For now, with the URL being the source of truth, I cannot think of other ideas to work around this.
Yep, makes sense that something like an "MLflow board" with support for actually persisting plot/dashboard configs in the background is the ideal long-term solution
